refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: wocky_strdiff ()
refsect2.para: Return TRUE if the given strings are different. Unlike strcmp this function will handle null pointers, treating them as distinct from any string.

listitem.simpara: The first string to compare (may be NULL)
The second string to compare (may be NULL)
FALSE if left and right are both NULL, or if neither is NULL and both have the same contents; TRUE otherwise

refsect2.title: wocky_decode_jid ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean wocky_decode_jid (const gchar *jid, gchar **node, gchar **domain, gchar **resource);
refsect2.para: If the JID is valid, returns TRUE and sets the caller's node/domain/resource pointers if they are not NULL. The node and resource pointers will be set to NULL if the respective part is not present in the JID. The node and domain are lower-cased because the Jabber protocol treats them case-insensitively.
XXX: Do nodeprep/resourceprep and length checking.

listitem.simpara: address to which return the username/room part of the JID
address to which return the server/service part of the JID
address to which return the resource/nick part of the JID
